definition: to grow without restraint/overflowing with/to happen unexpectedly

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to be full of wit and humor

sentences.chinese: 意想不到的事情，总是妙趣横生。

sentences.english: That joke is a classic; it really is funny.
sentences.chinese: 这个笑话确属一流，真是妙趣横生。

sentences.english: May you live in interesting times, May you find what you are looking for.
sentences.chinese: 愿你生活的时代妙趣横生，愿你心中所想能美梦成真。

sentences.english: How to use the audience problem to make boring data interesting.
sentences.chinese: 如何利用听众的问题，将枯燥的数字变得妙趣横生。

sentences.english: You can hardly expect scintillating conversation from a kid that age.
sentences.chinese: 你几乎想不到那么点儿的孩子会说出妙趣横生的话来。

sentences.english: They are so cocky but also funny.
sentences.chinese: 他们如此高傲自大，但同时也妙趣横生。

definition: growing as a thicket/overgrown/breaking out everywhere (of disease, social disorder etc)
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
branches and knots/fig. side issue/minor peripheral problem
intertwined (of tree roots or branches)/fig. an intricate matter
lit. the spring comes upon a withered tree (idiom)/fig. to get a new lease on life/to be revived/(of a difficult situation) to suddenly improve
